title: Projects
text:
A selection of data science projects showcasing different techniques and technologies.


An interactive web application built with Shiny for exploring and visualizing the Iris dataset.



Iris Data Visualization


This project demonstrates object-oriented Python design patterns applied to a real-world data visualization application. It uses Shiny for interactivity and Plotly for dynamic visualizations.

title: Data Explorer - Iris Dataset
text:
An interactive web application built with Shiny for exploring and visualizing the Iris dataset. This app allows you to filter data by species and view correlations between sepal and petal measurements.


The Data Explorer app provides an interactive interface for analyzing the Iris dataset:



Iris Data Visualization


This visualization shows the relationship between sepal length and petal length, colored by species. The app allows you to filter by species and view detailed measurements for each data point.



Interact with the live Shiny application below:





Species Filter: Select individual iris species or view all data
Interactive Visualization: Hover over data points to see detailed measurements
Data Table: View the filtered dataset in a formatted table
Dynamic Updates: All visualizations update in real-time based on your selection




To run this application on your machine:
# Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt

# Start the Shiny app
cd projects/data
shiny run app.py
Then visit http://127.0.0.1:8000 in your browser.



Technology Stack: - Python 3.9 - Shiny for Python - Pandas for data manipulation - Plotly for interactive visualizations
Repository: add links to notebooks and artifacts.

title: Home
text:
Welcome to my portfolio. Below are featured projects and an interactive data demo.



Project: Predictive modeling of housing prices — see details in the Projects section.




Run the sample Shiny app locally and open:

http://127.0.0.1:8000 (Shiny app)

You can embed the running app using an iframe in a hosted environment.
